page.title: 15HYDROLOGY STUDY BALQUHIDDER
page.content: The Institute of Hydrology is involved in a programme of fieldwork in the Balquhidder area to study the effects of forestry on streamflow. Due to the rising prices and reduced availability of timber for import, an expansion of forestry is taking place in Britain, much of it in the Scottish uplands. With the expansion of forestry in Scotland the Institute of Hydrology was asked by the Forestry Commission and the Hydro Electric Board to carry out a study in Kirkton and Upper Monachyle Glens. The Institute has for many years been studying the effect of forestry on streamflow in upland Wales where the climatic conditions are very different to those of the Highlands of Scotland. The Balquhidder study is expected to take five years.
